basics.name: Hugo Serieys
basics.label: I am a french computer science student passionate by this field, I am always curious to discover new languages, algorithms and innovation about technology and science.

work.summary: Internship among the research team. My internship topic is about a specific deep learning problem : visual domain adaptation (domain adaptation focused on images).
highlights: Implementation of state-of-the-art algorithms from papers
Benchmark of these algorithms on given image datasets
Original contribution resulting with a scientific paper.

work.summary:
During my journey at Mines de Saint Etienne, I had the opportunity to work on a project between a team of student and a company: EURA NOVA.

The goal of the project was to design a proof of concept on a automated video analysis application.
highlights: Writing of a specification document according to client needs
Bibliographic research on technical needs for the project
Technical answer to the specification document (schedule using GANTT diagram, to do list, tools to use, risks assessment...)
Design of the project presentation poster
Global project management (tasks distribution, decision making)
Communication between every stakeholders (client, supervisor, team)
Meeting facilitation
Project presentation pitch

work.summary: Implementation of a web interface for connected objects management.
highlights: Secured authentication system with differents users rights (administrator and users, passwords management system)
Database storing data relative to the connected objets and data relative to users
User friendly interface to easily access to connected objects data
Administrator interface for accounts management
Customized file generation system (CSV format) to collect connected objects data
Automatic back-up archives creation system

work.company: Information system department of french social ministries
work.summary: During this internship, I completed many different tasks around computer maintenance.
highlights: Use of an issue tracking system for users reports
Use of a LDAP directory management system
Inventory of computer buffer store
Computer maintenance (printer, computer problems...)
I also spent a couple of days in the business incubator of the ISD, where public startups are hosted. I spent a whole day with a web developer who showed me many of his working methods.

education.institution: École des Mines de Saint-Étienne (Gardanne, France)
education.studyType: Master degree in computer science and electronics
courses: Object oriented programming using C++ and Java
Web and mobile development (NodeJS, TypeScript and Kotlin)
Introduction to cryptography (AES implementation in C++, see projets)
Database management using PostGreSQL and Glassfish
Embedded C on STM32 & PIC18 microcontrollers (see projets)
Graph theory and mathematical optimization using C
Computer networks using Cisco Packet Tracer

skills.name: Graphic design and art related skills

projects.name: TIPE - Etude d'un goniomètre acoustique
projects.summary:
During my two year course before engineering school, I did a research project (sort of a micro-thesis) about acoustic angle measuring systems : how to localize an acoustic source.
I made many researches, experiments, simulations, contact with a researcher.

projects.name: Robot design
projects.summary: One year pair working project on a robot design including each steps of th conception.
highlights: soldering of electronics components
Study (experiments and simulation) of the components used on the microchip
software development conforming given specifications
Simulation and field tests.

projects.name: AES algorithm
projects.summary: This project is part of a cryptography course I have followed with my school. The project is available on my github account, written in C++. It's a really small project (I spent about 10 hours on it), but it enabled me to discover in details one of the most used symmetric-key cryptography algorithm.

projects.name: Connected inesweeper game
projects.summary: Design of a connected minesweeper game in Java:
highlights: Game rules management
User interface
Network game management using sockets and threads

projects.name: Robot design
projects.summary: Design of a robot from conception to real tests. The robot is controlled by a smartphone using Bluetooth communication. It is able to move forward and backward at different speeds, and can park himself automaticaly at a saved position.
highlights: Pre-study before actual implementation: algorigrams, pseudo-code, robot architecture (superviser/controler)
Implementation in embedded C on STM32.
